Package com.example.carturestibackend.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.example.carturestibackend.controllers.UserController
@RestController @CrossOrigin @RequestMapping("/user") public class UserController extends Object
Controller class to handle HTTP requests related to users.

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<UserDTO>> getUsers()
      Retrieves all users.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of UserDTO objects representing the users.

    • insertUser

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Long> insertUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserDTO userDTO)
      Inserts a new user.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - The UserDTO object representing the user to insert.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the ID of the newly inserted user.

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("/{id_user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> getUser(@PathVariable("id_user") long userID)
      Retrieves a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the UserDTO object representing the retrieved user.

      @GetMapping("/name/{name}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> getUserByName(@PathVariable("name") String name)
      Retrieves a user by their name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:

    • getUserByEmail

      @GetMapping("/email/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> getUserByEmail(@PathVariable("email") String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/{id_user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteUser(@PathVariable("id_user") long userID)
      Deletes a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to delete.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the success of the operation.

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/{id_user}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> updateUser(@PathVariable("id_user") String userID, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserDTO userDTO)
      Updates a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to update.
      userDTO - The updated UserDTO object representing the new state of the user.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the updated UserDTO object.
